Description: Marl pottery vase, of late wavy handle type, nearly cylindrical in shape, body swelling to slight shoulder, with inset neck, everted rim, and applied band of clay with impressed decoration around shoulder. Lower body scraped diagonally to trim.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna (London, 1911), p.23 cf pl. xxxiii.55a. Like Wavy handled W56G in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. H126 marked on base in ink.
